medical_history.chief_complaint: Monosymptomatic hypochondriasis, specifically dysmorphophobia and olfactory reference syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A's symptoms began gradually as she lost effectiveness at work due to her belief in developing deep wrinkles on her face, spending hours each day examining her face in front of a mirror. Her condition worsened over six months, leading to hospitalization. Mr. B complained of an 'anal odor' that started after his lover left him, becoming a source of embarrassment and rituals to check for seepage, lasting for one year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients had no history of drug or alcohol abuse, no other psychiatric disorders, and no relevant past medical conditions.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. A was a married mother and had a job as a physician's secretary. Mr. B was a homosexual man who left his job due to embarrassment. Both had notably normal lifestyles apart from their psychological issues.
